meanings.definition: Bicarbonate of soda: a white crystalline powder used in baking as a leavening agent.
meanings.sent1: I added a pinch of bicarb to the cake batter to make it rise.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for bicarb to help the cookies become fluffy.
meanings.sent3: The bicarb jumped out of the pantry and said, 'Let's bake some magic!'
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like bicarb, lifting everyone's spirits in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The bicarb danced in the bowl, creating bubbles of joy in the batter.

meanings.definition: A solution of bicarbonate of soda in water, used as an antacid.
meanings.sent1: My mom always keeps a bottle of bicarb for heartburn relief.
meanings.sent2: After a heavy meal, a glass of bicarb water can soothe the stomach.
meanings.sent3: The bicarb solution whispered, 'I'll calm the tummy troubles away.'
meanings.sent4: His kindness worked like bicarb, neutralizing any tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bicarb mixture fizzed gently, bringing comfort to the upset stomach.
